Reading Data for BentoBox

Nicole Kramer

Source: vignettes/reading_data_for_bentobox.Rmd
reading_data_for_bentobox.Rmd

BentoBox handles a wide array of genomic data types in various formats and file types. Not only does it work with data.frames, data.tables, tibbles, and Bioconductor GRanges and GInteractions objects, but it can also read in common genomic file types like BED, BEDPE, bigWig, and .hic files. While files can be read directly into BentoBox plotting functions, BentoBox also provides functions for reading in these large genomic data sets to work with them within the R environment:

  • bbReadBigwig(): Read in entire bigWig files, or read in specific genomic regions or strands of bigWig data. Please note that this function does not work on Windows.
bwFile <- system.file("extdata/test.bw", package="BentoBoxData")

## Read in entire file
bwFileData <- bbReadBigwig(file = bwFile)

## Read in specified region
bwRegion <- bbReadBigwig(file = bwFile,
                        chrom = "chr2",
                        chromstart = 1,
                        chromend = 1500)
     
## Read in specified region on "+" strand
bwRegionPlus <- bbReadBigwig(file = bwFile,
                            chrom = "chr2",
                            chromstart = 1, 
                            chromend = 1500,
                            strand = "+")

The resulting file will contain seqnames, start, end, width, strand, and score columns:

head(bwRegion)
#>   seqnames start  end width strand score
#> 1     chr2     1  300   300      * -1.00
#> 2     chr2   301  600   300      * -0.75
#> 3     chr2   601  900   300      * -0.50
#> 4     chr2   901 1200   300      * -0.25
#> 5     chr2  1201 1500   300      *  0.00
  • bbReadHic(): Read in genomic regions of .hic files with various data resolutions and normalizations.
hicFile <- system.file("extdata/test_chr22.hic", package="BentoBoxData")

hicDataChrom <- bbReadHic(file = hicFile,
    chrom = "chr22", assembly = "hg19",
    resolution = 250000, res_scale = "BP", norm = "NONE"
)

hicDataChromRegion <- bbReadHic(file = hicFile,
    chrom = "chr22", assembly = "hg19",
    chromstart = 20000000, chromend = 47500000,
    resolution = 100000, res_scale = "BP", norm = "KR"
)

These data will be output in 3-column dataframe in sparse upper triangular matrix format:

head(hicDataChromRegion)
#>    chr22_A  chr22_B    counts
#> 1 20000000 20000000 55.390347
#> 2 20000000 20100000  6.737655
#> 3 20100000 20100000 31.963037
#> 4 20000000 20200000  3.204865
#> 5 20100000 20200000 12.864663
#> 6 20200000 20200000 37.828201

It is also possible to use bbReadHic for interchromosomal Hi-C data:

twoChroms <- bbReadHic(file = "/path/to/hic",
    chrom = "chr1", altchrom = "chr2",
    resolution = 250000, res_scale = "BP"
)

For other filetypes, we recommend reading in files with data.table or rtracklayer.

library(data.table)
data <- data.table::fread("/path/to/file")

library(rtracklayer)
data <- rtracklayer::import(con = "/path/to/file", format = "fileFormat")
